The MNF Party shall endeavour to implement the following manifesto in the coming MLA Election 2018.
 POLITICAL:
 1. In tune with 'the VN Declaration on the right of Indegeneous people, dated 13.9.2007, the MNF shall strife towards achieving Mizo integration under one administrative umbrella.
 2. In line with the provision of Mizoram Peace Accord, Mizo culture .and religious practices, shall always be upheld and protected.
 3. The provision of permanent peace as visualised in the Memorandum of Settlement 1986, the MNF Party shall endeavour to maintain peace in the State of Mizoram. However, some provisions of the peace accord, which are not yet implemented properly, shall have to be implemented.
 4. Special scheme shall be drawn-up for the Martars and their families, including rehabilitation and resettlement of all the underground personnels, in line with the provisions of the Memorandum of Settlement, 1986.
 5. Mizoram State Boundaries shall be protected and the welfare of the people residing in the border areas, shall be looked into.
 6. Along the line and principles of National Registration of Citizenship, the MNF shall introduce village Register, for the purpose of determining genuine citizens and for detecting illegal immigrants.
 7. As provided in the Memorandum of Settlement, minority tribes inside Mizoram, shall be well-looked after.
 8. Step will be taken to implement Border Trade in line with the provisions of Memorandum of Settlement, 1986.

 ADMINISTRATION:
 The MNF Party shall establish transparent Government along the line and principles of Good Governance. The MNF Party shall carry on good works which were initiated by the previous government.
 1. In order to check corruption, the MNF Government shall establish vigilance commission/Lok Ayukta.
 2. The MNF shall try to form a government in tune with the principles of transparency and R.T.I Act 2005.
 3. In line with the principles of decentralisation, the MNF Government shall strengthen Aizawl Municipal Corporation and Local Councils. More Municipal Councils/Boards shall be established in all District Capitals and Sub-Divisional towns within the framework of Indian Constitution.
 4. In pursuance of provision under Articles 243 of the Indian Constitution, District Development Council and Village Councils shall be established wherever practicable and necessary.
 5. The MNF GoveTment shall try to enforce merit selection in matters of recruitment and promotion of Government servants. Effort shall be made to review and revise the working system of Employment Exchange and Mizoram Public Service Commission, so as to ensure impartiality.
 6. E-Governance shall be introduced in all Department.
 7. The Mizoram Land Revenue Act 2013 shall be reviewed and revised. New chapter shall be introduced in matters of land reform, establishment of Revenue Tributional and to standardise the Mizoram Urban Areas Rent Control Act.
 8. In matters of contract works and supply of materials preferential treatment shall be given to the citizen of Mizoram.
 9. Rules and Regulations under State Transport Authority governing vehicle condemnation, tax system and permit system, shall be reviewed and revised.
 10. Welfare of the Ex-Service people, Muster —Roll and Contractual Workers shall be looked into and systematised.
 11. The Assam Rifle centres shall be shifted to Zokhawsang and the buildings and lands shall be utilised for public purpose only.
 12. In order to make better administration in State Capital and District Capitals, new Civic Law shall be introduced.
 13. Rules governing contract works under Public Works Department (PWD) shall be reviewed and revised.

 ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMMES
 1. Steps shall be taken as soon as MNF. Ministry is formed to implement Socio­Economic Development Programmes (SEDP), as enshrined in the booklet.
 2. In order to achieve Self Sufficiency in the production of food stuff, assistances for farmers and other workers shall be given as soon as possible, in tune with the SEDP guidelines.
 3. Apart from giving necessary aid and assistance, to the workers new marketing system shall . be introduced to facilitated selling of farm produces and other products. Such facilities shall include minimum support price system, "subsidies, insurance and rebate, etc.
 4. Food Processing Industries shall be given priorities special attention shall be given to Ginger cultivation and ginger markets.
 5. Special Development Scheme (in a cluster system) shall be worked out, to facilitated all kind of manual workers, in the process of cultivation processing, manufacturing and marketing.
 6. As envisaged in the scheme of SEDP, effort shall be made to initiate various industries, including farming, manufacturing, mining, Eco-Tourism, adventure tourism. Agro and Forest- based Industries including bamboo processing, herbal and pharmaceutical and service industries, shall be given utmost attention.
 7. Worker facility schemes such as — Accidental insurance (PMJJY), Health Care Scheme, Crop Insurance (PMFBY), Group Insurance (under SBI Scheme) and E.P.F shall be effectively implemented.
 8. Worker Facility Scheme under Mizoram Building and other Construction Workers Welfare Board shall be reviewed and revised.
 9. Standard Vegetable shops, meat shops and other requirements shall be introduced.

 INFRASTRUTURE DEVELOPMENT
 1. The existing State and National Highways shall be properly maintained. New roads connecting East-West and North-South shall be constructed wherever necessary. Attempt will be made to make inland water- ways by development river courses.
 2. For the benefits of farmers, economic roads and agriculture link roads shall be constructed wherever necessary.
 3. Lengpui Airport shall be improved in all possible ways, so as to enable cargo plane operations. Attempt will be made for New airport in the Southern area of Mizoram.
 4. Lunglei town shall be further developed by creating more facilities and amenities for its population. Lunglei High Power Committee shall be given more power and funds. Attempt will be made to established different offices like Area Commissioner Office, University Campus, Police Southern Range, etc.
 5. Attempt will be made to make Mizoram Self Sufficient in matters of power generation. Utmost effort shall be made to generate Solar Energy, and other renewable energy apart from tapping hydro-power energy.
 6. Tourist Resorts and Institute of Hotel Management, initiated by the MNF -Ministry in 2008, shall be taken up afresh and improved. And Eco-Tourism shall be given high priority.
 7. Attempt will be made to construct more FCI Godowns, Gas Bottling Plants and Petroleum Oil Depots.
 8. Effort shall be made to complete Oil and Gas survey and explorations so as to speed up economic development of the State.
 SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT AND SOCIAL SECURITY
 1. The MLPC Act 2014 shall be withdrawn forthwith. Better and improved Rehabilitation Centres shall be established in Cooperation with NGO's and Churches.
 2. Hospital and Health: Centres shall be better equipped. Shortage of Doctor and Nurses shall be met by recruiting more doctors and nurses.
 3. Mizoram State Health Care Scheme will be revised and implemented.
 4. Old-age pension shall be awarded to all persons who are within the bracket. of old-age pension scheme.
 5. The PWD Act shall be applied to all cases of physical and mental handicapcy, throughout Mizoram.
 6. Women and Child right shall be enforced in right earnest.
 7. Grant of relief shall be given immediately to the victims of national calamities. In the case of death of the sole bread-earner of the family a scheme shall be drawn up to bring up and support the minors of the family.
 8. Public distribution system of essential commodities shall be upgraded, so as to cater the need of the consumers better. The MNF government shall try to improve, LPG distribution, water and electric supply.
 9. Attempt will be made to provide House site for those who are homeless and helpless.
 10. Utmost effort shall be made in all possible ways, to revive Mizo Tlawmngaihna (which spring-out from the spirit of natural principle of justice, honesty, fairness, perseverance and selflessness).

 EDUCATION and YOUTH AFFAIRS
 1. School Calendar and School timing shall be revised and re-adjusted so as to suit Mizo work 'culture and food habit.
 2. Student Scholarship shall be paid in a timely 'manner and student loan for higher studies shall be made available to all deserving students.
 3. System of education shall be reformed to heighten educational standard comparable with the education standard in any other advanced countries.
 4. Existing educational Institution shall .be upgraded and improved. Various need of the teachers and students may be provided. Shortage of teachers shall be addressed.
 5. Service facilities such as Provident Fund, Pension, Health Insurance shall be given to all workers who are serving under different scheme of centrally sponsored programmes. Teachers working in Private and aided schools, including school run by the churches shall also be given similar facilities.
 6. Institute for medical studies, para-medical, engineering, Technology and Management shall be established as soon as possible. 7. In order to enable bright students to study in foreign countries, step will be taken for Man-Power Development.
 8. Sports policy shall be framed in tune with the provisions of Olympics charter. Sports facilities shall be provided to all Institutions and Academy. More fund will be provided in Sports budget.
 9. Incentive Award scheme shall be drawn up so as to attract young students who will be-able to quality themselves for All India Services and Military Services.
 10. Student hostel shall be established in all District Headquarters if needed.
 11. Entrepreneurship Training shall be taken up on thrust programme basis.
 *********************

Kum 2013 Inthlanpui laia kan Manifesto-a kan lo dah tawh, a bul kan lo tan tawhte chu kan chhunzawm zel ang a. Tihhlawhtlin atana tha, a bul kan la tan hman lohte pawh theihtawpin kan bawhzui zel dawn a. Chutiang kan hmachhawp hrang hrang chu tuna kan Manifesto-ah hian kan rawn dah nawn kher lova. A hnuaia kan han tarlante hi Sorkarna kan chan leh chuan kan ngaihpawimawh hmasak tura kan chhawp chhuahte an ni :
 

01. Mizoram mipui mamawhna en chungin NLUP hi kan chhunzawm zel ang a. A tul dan a zirin a Kaihhruaina (Guidelines) pawh siamthat zel a ni ang a. Pawisa hlutna tlahniam zel avangin tanpuina pawh tihsan a ni ang. 

02. NEDP hi kan chhunzawm zel ang a. NEDP atang hian thalaiten mahnia eizawnna an neih theih dan tur kawng hrang hrang zau zawkin kan ruahman zel ang. 

03. Thingtlang leh khawpuia cheng miretheite chenna in sakna tur Scheme, tuna kan kalpui mek aia nasa zawk hian kan kalpui ang a. Police Department leh Education Department hnuaia thawktute Quarters sak dan tur pawh kan ruahman ang. 

04. Mizoram State Health Care Scheme leh India Sorkar Health Care Scheme, Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PMJAY) te chu kaihfinin, tunah hian damloten Rs.5,00,000/- thleng an hmu let thei tawh a. Amaherawhchu, hmang tangkai thei lo mi tam tak an la awm avangin mi zawng zawngin an hman tangkai theih nan hma kan la ang a. Chhungkaw harsa zual, natna khirh tak tak tuartuten Rs.5,00,000/- aia tam pawh an hmuh let theih nan ruahmanna kan siam bawk ang. 

05. Doctor awm lohna hmuna damlo, rang taka Doctor awmna hmun Damdawi In hnai an thlen vat theih nan leh hmun dang pan leh ngai a nih pawha an pan nghal zung zung theih nan Ambulance Network mumal tak kan siam ang. 

06. Mizoram Institute of Medical Education and Research (MIMER) hi India rama Damdawi lam zirna hmun tha berte zinga lang phak ngei turin kan enkawl zui ang. 

07. Pianphunga rualbanlo, fahrah, hmeithai, parawl leh chhungkaw vanduai bikte hnenah chhawmdawlna tam zawk kan pe ang.


08. Kum tinin HSLC leh a chunglam pass thar zawng zawng hnenah a thlawnin Laptop kan pe vek zel ang a. A bul tan nan HSLC leh a chunglam pass tawh, eizawnna nghet la nei lo zawng zawng hnenah Laptop kan pe vek ang. 

09. Science, Mathematics leh Technical lam zirna kan ngaipawimawh zel dawn a. Heng zirna kawnga harsatna kan neihte sukiang tur hian theihtawp kan chhuah zel ang. Chutih rualin, Science leh Mathematics tel lo hian HSLC chunglamah zir tur tam tak a awm avang leh thawh tur tam tak a awm tho avangin Science leh Mathematics lama harsatna neiten heng Subject tel lova HSLC an paltlang theih nan ruahmanna kan siam ang. 

10. College leh University zirlaiten Excursion leh Study Tour an neih thin theih nan kum tin Budget-ah sum kan dah ang. 

11. Mizoram zirna kalphung hi Mizoram Education Reforms Commission Recommendation leh zirna lama entawn tlak ramte tihdan en chungin siamthat ngai apiang siamthat chhunzawm zel a ni ang. 

12. Ruihtheih thil avanga harsatna tawkte enkawl hna hi mi inpete, Kohhran leh Central YMA ten theihtawp chhuahin an thawk reng a. Sorkar pawhin theihtawp chhuahin, hetiang lama harsatna tawkte enkawlna hmun, Rehabilitation Centre changtlung tak, a tul zat zat kan din ang a. Hetiang harsatna tawk hi an tlem tial tial theih nan Kohhran leh Tlawmngai Pawlte nen thawk hovin Sorkarin Counselling Centre hmun hrang hrangah a din bawk ang. 

13. Sorkarna kan siam atanga kum khat chhungin chhiatrupna (Disaster) thleng thei atana kan inbuatsaih lawk dan tur leh chutiang chhiatrupna a lo thlen thulha kan hmachhawn dan tur ruahmanna kan lo siam tawhte hi ennawnin, siamthat ngai apiang kan siamtha ang a. Hetiang chhiatna lo thlen avanga Central Sorkar atanga tanpuina kan hmuh thin belhchhah nan kan State Budget-ah sum kan dah bawk ang. 

14. Ramngaw, nungcha leh tuihna humhalh kawngah a neitu mipuiten nasa zawka tha an thawh theih nan ruahmanna kan siam ang a. Hemi atan hian Budget-ah pawh sum kan dah zel ang.


15. Hmasawnna hnathawh hrang hrang, kawng laih leh a enkawl zui chungchangah te, Electric line enkawl leh Energy Bill khawn chungchangahte leh thil dang dangah mipuiten tha an thawh ve theih nan ruahmanna kan siam ang. 

16. Hydel Project ngaihthah chuang lovin, tun aia nasaa Nizung Chakna kan hman tangkai theih nan Solar Power Plant kan siam belh zel ang a, thingtlang hmun kilkhawr zawkah a tam thei ang ber siam kan tum ang. 

17. Sorkar Department hrang hrangte hnena sum pek hmanna tura Project siamte ngun taka zir chiang a, kalpui chi a nih leh nih loh chungchanga thutlukna siam tur leh, hna thawh a nih laia enzuia vilvengtu tur, thuneihna sang tak nei, “Project Assessment and Monitoring Committee” kan siam ang a. Hemi atan hian State Planning Board pawh thuam that a ni ang. 

18. Tourism-ah nasa zawkin hma kan lak chhunzawm zel ang a. Hemi kawnga kan mamawh, Institute of Hotel Management, a building pawh kan sak zawh tawhah hian a rang thei ang berin zirna kan tan bawk ang. 

19. Music leh Fine Arts lam tihhmasawn nan hma kan la zui zel dawn a. Tuna Amphitheatre leh concert lian leh Inkhawmpui lian nghah theihna tur Convention Centre kan tender mek tawhte bakah hian infrastructure lamah leh zirna lam thlengin chak takin hma kan la ang. 

20. Lirthei hmanga infiamna (Motor Sports) lama kan thalaite tuina leh theihna hi tihtak zeta tuipui tham a nih avangin, tuna infiamna hrang hrang kan chawikang mek ang hian Motor Sports lam hi nasa takin tihmasawn kan tum ang a, Racing Track pawh kan siam ang. 

21. Central Sorkar Dan, “Working Journalists and Other Newspaper Employees Condition of Service Act, 1955” hi Mizoramah a tak taka hman hleih theih a nih loh avangin Journalist-ten hamthatna an hmuh theihte hi ennawnin kan siamtha ang.

.
